overview_of_class: This course is a general survey of Russian Literature, focused on the interconnections between new ideas in culture and politics. Texts include great Modernist novels Peterburg (1913) by Andrei Bely, Master and Margarita (1940) by Mikhail Bulgakov, and Evgeny Zamiatin's We (1921); poetry by Aleksandr Blok, Vladimir Mayakovsky, Osip Mandelstam. These major literary works are discussed in the broad Russian and European cultural and historical context.
name: 20th-Century Russian Literature
subject: SLAVIC
